reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Having read reviews for this hotel i was expecting it to be a bit out of the way, but actually found the location to be fantastic! We walked to the sony centre in about 10 minutes, and from there all the main attractions in East Berlin are sign posted and can be reached on foot! A five minute walk in the opposite direction finds you surrounded by lovely pavement cafes and bars, great restaurants and quaint little independant shops. There is also a market square at Winterfeldplatz. In the immediate vicinity of the hotel is the Bülowstraße u bahn station which takes about 30 seconds to walk to and is 3 stops from zoo station. There are a few bars on the street, one a few doors down from the hotel which has a fairly good jukebox, and plenty of fast food joints which are cheap and cheerful. Around the corner is a newsagent which sells British newspapers if you so require! Although it is next to the rail line we never heard any noise from it, or any of the local businesses. The hotel itself was perfect for us for a few days away. The rooms are an adequate size, with a small seating area with a sofa, arm chair and coffee table and a small tv. There is also a small fridge which doubles as a mini bar, reasonably priced but we used it to store drinks we bought at a near by shop! The bathroom is admittedly small, with no bath, just a shower cubicle, but that suited us fine as we didn't spend much time in it! The breakfast is great, with plenty of fresh fruit, cereals, yoghurt, various types of breads, cheeses and cold meats and salads. For a hot breakfast there were boiled or scrambled eggs, sausages and what looked like lamb koftas. They also had several types of fruit juice, a pot of coffee on every table and several varieties of tea. All in all a great hotel at a great price. We will definitely stay there again.
reviews.title: Great hotel

reviews.text: We could find nothing wrong with the hotel room it was clean had everything in it you needed, bathroom was a bit small but served its purpose, the hotel is on a main road plus the train line also runs past the hotel so can be a bit noisy if you have the windows open or if you are a light sleeper take some ear plugs. It is between two underground stops Nollendorf Platz {more lines leave from here} and Bulow Str both only a few mins away from the hotel, can't coment on the food as we did not eat there we were on room only. Found all the staff friendly and helpful. The area in front of the hotel seems to be a picking up place for prostitutes but they were not a problem. Berlin is a big city so chek the hotel is in the right area for you.
reviews.title: Good Value

reviews.text: ANGELIKI, GREECE
reviews.title: Great experience-great location-great value of money

reviews.text: The room is quiet spacious, with even a safer, a sofa and 2 chairs. The bathroom is a little bit small but well equipped. Be careful there is not AC during the hot months.

reviews.text: You could do worse with this hotel, but you could also do better...much better. I took this hotel for the low price and I definitely got what I paid for.

reviews.text: It's in an OK location (but definitely not a great location). It's right by the subway (U2 stop Bulowstr.). The area is very residential, but it's not too far to get to the tourist sites in East or West Berlin (I think it's in West Berlin, but relatively close to East). The area seems safe - just not much there.

reviews.title: Nice Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Convenient location. Berlin has two centres (in the east and in the west) and this is pretty much in the middle whilst in a 'liveable' area with places to eat around Nollendorfplatz. It is very near to Bulowstrasse station from which you can go direct to the western or eastern centres.
reviews.title: Excellent service, cleanliness and comfort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed three nights. Hotel is drab and shabby but the room was fine - warm, clean and comfortable. Small bathroom but everything worked - TV, safe,shower etc. Really good breakfast with plenty of choice and some fine breads, coffee pots on all tables provided (nice touch). The location is within walking distance of Potsdam Platz in one direction and Ku'Damm (shopping area) in the other. But its not a nice area; there are prostitutes working across the road from the hotel (though this is not a problem). There are very few proper restaurants nearby but plenty of small bistros. Unfortunately these seemed to function mainly as meeting places for men only (at night anyway).
reviews.title: No problems

reviews.text: Friendly helpful staff, a good value hotel.
reviews.title: great location

likes.liked: — Suway station (Buelowstr.) was 50m away, Potsdamerplatz was about 2-3 stops from there

reviews.text: Great location, simple hotel. Subway station was just 50m away, on the line to City-Center. Berlin is anyway a cheap city, Aldea Hotel too.

reviews.title: Disappointing
Cheap & (Sort of) Cheerful
reviews.text: I stayed at Agon Aldea for the second time now, and I still think it's great-great value for money.

reviews.title: What we think
reviews.text: We have recently had a 5 day stay at the Aldea.

The Hotel sits by a very busy crossroads . To the front of the Hotel, the Underground station runs across the front of the building above ground (this is now closed until 1st December 2006). However, it is extremely noisy when operating. To one side of the building, during the late evening/night, the street is taken over by Hookers and Transvestites. There is much horn honking and derisive shouting throughout the night from clients and passing cars.
reviews.title: Aldea, Oh dear you mean!
OK
reviews.text: The Hotel has double glazing which minimises the noise but no air con. While we were there it was so hot, we needed the windows open. A fan deadened the noise and enabled us to get some sleep.

reviews.title: Super spot
reviews.text: The Hotel itself is very clean although somewhat dated. Our room was a good size, immaculately clean and the bedding and towels white but a little threadbare. The shower room, small but adequate. Our bedding was not changed during our stay. The complimentary toiletries consist of a combined wash/shower/shampoo liquid above the sink and in the shower cubicle. There is no complimentary 'hospitality tray' - but we do not know if these tea/coffee facilities are usual in other German establishments.

We had a plumbing leak which was promptly dealt with by a very polite and helpful staff member. Some staff have a rather short, sharp manner but maybe this is the 'german way' rather than 'impolite indifference'.
reviews.title: Good and bad

reviews.text: Was a little apprehensive after reading other reviews, but this hotel fit our needs - inexpensive hotel in a decent location for getting around Berlin. Was a short walk -- 5 minutes to the U because the S was not yet running. Had a view of the train line though from the hotel - but we could only here cars when we opened the window for fresh air.
reviews.title: Decent & inexpensive

likes.disliked: — The S bahn construction which will be complete by January 2007

reviews.text: Hotel was very basic, TV did have english news station, but that was about it. But still entertaining to watch what was on german TV after a night out.
reviews.title: Loved Room 433

reviews.text: Street doesn't seem the safest at night but wasn't traveling alone.

reviews.text: Found a great restaurant, Cafe Vienna I believe it was called, a few blocks northwest of the hotel.
reviews.title: A very good hotel

likes.disliked: — a bit boring outside the rooms

reviews.text: Only issue we had was the staff who had to check the mini bar while we were getting going (rather late, after being out the night before) in the early afternoon.
reviews.title: Did very well for us

reviews.text: I stayed at this hotel last weekend, and having read some of the reviews on this site was a little aprehensive. However my fears were unfounded and I was pleasantly surprised. I'm not sure what people expect, but having prepaid €185.00 for a double room for three nights including breakfast, I felt we got much more than our money's worth. O.K so maybe it wasn't a 4 star hotel but it's a very good 3 star. While I have little interest in staying in ultra luxurious hotel (almost always a rip off) I am quite fussy, particularly about hygiene and queitness and a comfortable bed. The place was spotless, the staff were friendly, great breakfast. Why are some of the contributors so hung up on the hallways? (painted various shades of grey) as someone has already said how much time do you spend in a hotel hallway? From a location point of view it's less than two minutes walk from the nearest metro station, less than five minutes walk from Nollendorflatz, which is hopping with gay nightlife. I'd stay there again and recommend it to anyone. One small thing. The metro runs above the street so if you are a light sleeper you might want to get a room at the back of a hotel as we did.
reviews.title: Better than I expected
Right on the money
reviews.text: Just back from a weekend in this hotel. As per previous reviewer, was a little apprehensive after reading reports of gloomy depressing hallways and unhelpful staff.
The staff that we came across were all very helpful and courteous. The hallways were a little on the depressing side, but seriously, how much time do you spend in your hotel hallway?
reviews.title: A perfect base!
Depressing place
reviews.text: The rooms were spacious enough, everything was spotlessly clean, beds were comfortable. Proved to be a perfect base for our trip to Berlin - we spent two nights there. The U2 U-bahn line runs past the door - the nearest station is a couple of minutes' walk. The U2 line takes you to places like Potsdamer Platz, Alexanderplatz, the Zoo etc.

reviews.title: Clean, but that's all
reviews.text: Would be hard to beat this hotel for value-for-money. Highly recommended.
